meanings.definition: To make a shrill, cheerful sound.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirked happily in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She chirked with joy upon receiving good news.
meanings.sent3: The kettle chirked merrily as it boiled.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chirked through the room like a bright melody.
meanings.sent5: The children's chirk filled the air with happiness.

meanings.sent1: Her chirk attitude always brightened the room.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's chirk behavior brought smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent3: He had a chirk personality that was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The chirk colors of the painting lifted her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The chirk music made everyone want to dance.

meanings.sent1: The chirk of the crickets filled the night.
meanings.sent2: She woke up to the sweet chirk of the birds outside.
meanings.sent3: The chirk of the doorbell signaled their arrival.
meanings.sent4: The chirk of the stream was soothing to her ears.
meanings.sent5: The chirk of the wind chimes brought peace to the garden.
